subject: javax.swing.JOptionPane showMessageDialog not working in Junit
msgSnippet: Hi - I am trying to create a test case that requires the user to do something in another application.  So I wrote a little messageBox method with the code
messageBody:
Hi -

I am trying to create a test case that requires the user to do
something in another application. So I wrote a little messageBox
method with the code below,

/**
* Simple dialog to display a message.
* @param message
*/
private void messageBox(String message)
{
javax.swing.JOptionPane pane = new
javax.swing.JOptionPane(message);
javax.swing.JDialog dialog = pane.createDialog(new
javax.swing.JFrame(), "Dilaog");
pane.showMessageDialog(dialog, message, "Dialog",
pane.QUESTION_MESSAGE);
System.out.println("dialog done");
}

and call it from a Junit test case. Unfortunately, I never see the
dialog. Can someone explain and possibly offer a solution? Obviously
I have tested the messageBox with the code and then everything works.

thanks, D
